title: Vintage Pin box typeface?
content:
Hi All

Anyone able to identify the typeface for the word BOHIN on this old pin box???

THANKS!  
A.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pins_6044.jpg)
author: anniemack

comments.content:
A [good sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.ma-petite-brocante.com/6189-18710-thickbox/boite-ancienne-epingles-en-acier-couturex-extra-fines-bohin.jpg) always helps :)  
 [Corvinus](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/corvinus) (Skyline) comes close. Some more: [Marla](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-marla), [Citadel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/citadel), [Pall Mall](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/pall-mall-rr), [Keyboard](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/keyboard-rr), [Niagara](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/niagara), [Amati](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008024934/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/amati)
Wow - that is a better version of the true colours - thanks for your suggestions Ryuk!
